title: Krauthamer on emancipation among NA- support claim

content.prompt: Which of the following would best support the author’s claim in the passage that the end of the Civil War “offered little reason for jubilation” to enslaved African Americans living in the Choctaw and Chickasaw Nations?

choices.label: Like other Indigenous nations, the Choctaw and Chickasaw kept their codified system of racial slavery until after the practice had been abolished in the rest of the United States.
The Choctaw and Chickasaw nations were forcibly removed from their ancestral lands and moved west of the Mississippi in the Trail of Tears.
As was the case with other Indigenous nations, the lands of the Choctaw and Chickasaw had historically served as destinations for African Americans seeking to escape from slavery.
As a result of centuries of coexistence, many African Americans in the pre–Civil War South had come to have partial Indigenous ancestry.
